revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: To Markos Oulpios Herkoulanos, alias Herakleides, priest and exegetes, and to the Caesarii and other prytaneis.;From Pelops son of Pelops of the Propappodebasteian tribe and Zeneian deme, one of those who entered the ephebate in the eighth year of Divus Vespasianus. Since my son Pelops born to me from Sarapias daughter of ...eios (?), citizeness who is absent in the districts above Memphis, is of an age for introduction into the ephebes, and wishing to induct him into the ephebes of the present seventheenth year of Imperator Caesar Nerva Trajanus Germanicus Dacicus, I respect you to instruct the officials in charge of these matters ...

listBibl.bibl: Whitehorne J, PBingen , 285-287, no 68, 2000, Pl. 37 -- On the back there is one line broken at some point because the vertical fibers have been lost , and continued after 1.6 cm for about 0.5 cm and then is broken again. The preserved part consists of about 6-7 letters, which run vertical to the fibers. Only PSI XII 1226 has a note on the back "HYPOMNEMA EPHEBEIAS" of the person. However, a phrase like "HYPOMNEMA EPHEBEIAS PELOPOS PELOPOS" cannot be read. (NL; forthcoming)
